tracks.title: Arc - Free Download - Quotient 1/6
tracks.description:
Hello, I’m launching a new site dedicated to provide you with new music that you won’t be able to find anywhere else. There will be 6 parts, and every one of them will be free for members of the site.

This first track, called Arc, was one of my first experiments with some new analogue synths recently - the Moog Minituar, and the Dave Smith Instruments Prophet 08. I wanted to make something smooth and melodic which would work for my club sets, and would be mixable, but nothing too peak time intense, something a little softer. I think the heart of the track really all came down to squeesing the main riff with those lovely analogue filters!

If you would like to download this track, and receive promos of the rest of the new music before it goes public, then just click on the download button on the soundcloud player and all will be explained. In return for your email you will receive all 6 parts of the series for free, and they will not be released on any other platforms.

Thanks to Rabbithole for the excellent art work!

tracks.tag_list: Semiosis "Max Cooper" Dj Set Quotient Series number 2 of 6
tracks.title: Semiosis - DJ Set - Free DL - Quotient 2/6
tracks.description:
I’ve been pretty obsessed with simple ratios in the forms of chord progressions for as long as I can remember, hence all the long sustained chords in my music - for some reason I find chords even more satisfying in the lower frequencies, maybe we can pick out the ratios more clearly when they’re using slower wave fronts like with bass. I also love melodies and rhythms that combine different loop lengths so that interesting syncopation effects arise as a result of the ratios between the loop lengths. A lot of my favourite new tracks recently have used these types of techniques, so I decided to base a mix around them - Semiosis.

Semiosis is a process by which we create meaning from comparison. If I tell you a made up word that doesn’t relate to anything you know, you can get little meaning from it - meaning comes from what something isn’t, how it relates to other things you know. Music works in exactly this way, with us comparing meaningless wave frequencies to find feeling in how one value relates to another - a ratio.

Whether or not you like it, your subconscious mind is a massive maths geek, and it gets really excited when it finds a 1:3:5 ratio in the stream of air pressure information being received by your ears.  Ratio has the capacity to make us feel and make us dance. But it all happens without us being aware of it. 

When you listen to long drawn out chords and syncopating rhythms however, you can’t really get the full feeling from just a quick dip in, I find that it needs time for the ratios to wash over and sink in. The more time you give to it the more beauty you can find hidden in there. So the mix is very much of this long form, it doesn’t jump from one extreme to another like some of my other mixes, and needs to have some time to develop.

This is part 2 of 6 from the Quotient Series, all of which can be downloaded for free in return for signing up to my new download website, built specifically for bringing you new original tracks, remixes and mixes, which you won't be able to get from anywhere else. 

You can find the website here: http://bit.ly/CooperSound

tracks.tag_list: "rustle of the stars" "max cooper" remix rmx "drum and bass" electronica post classical modern distortion Epic
tracks.title: The Rustle Of The Stars - Sleeping Land - Max Cooper Rmx - Quotient 3/6
tracks.description:
FREE DOWNLOAD HERE: http://bit.ly/CooperSound
 
Your December free download is a remix, and an important piece of music to me personally. Partly because it was the result of a chance string of events driven by my love of the original track and a fortuitous meeting with Frederic D. Oberland, one half of The Rustle of the Stars with Richard Knox. And partly because I love the intensity and feeling of the original which I have tried to convey in my own way with little regard for the usual rules of making music - ambient strings arrangement at one end, and a drum and bass wall of sound at the other, because that's what I felt was required to communicate the emotions I found in the original piece, inspired by "a musical passage through the North Pole explorer diaries".  
 
Here's what Richard and Frederic said about the original:  "We would like to think of this as a polar journey to the ends of the earth through the arctic sea. We kept in mind the first polar expeditions, Edgar Allan Poe's Dream-Land, the ships trapped or crushed by ice, the point of no-return, the minds sinking, the attempt on the Pole ending in disaster, the quest of the Northwest Passage, Erebus & Terror, the Mercy Bay, Mangazeya, Charles Francis Hall, Beechey Island, the Midnight sun and the Polar night."
 
It's very winter-y. And I'm very pleased Richard and Frederic agreed to allow me to give the remix away for free to anyone who would like to hear it this Christmas!

The Rustle of the Stars - Sleeping Land (Part 1) - Max Cooper Remix

You can find the beautiful full album from the Rustle of the Stars, here: http://www.therustleofthestars.com/

tracks.tag_list: Piano solo "feedback matrix" "max cooper" "tom hodge" post Classical modern Artefact Ep "Part 1" Downtempo Electronic
tracks.title: Teotihuacan - Part 1 - with Tom Hodge - Quotient 4/6
tracks.description:
When I was touring in Mexico, I was lucky enough to have some days off during a visit to Mexico City, and took a trip to a nearby Toltec/Aztec Pyramid site called Teotihuacan. It's a beautiful place, but when I asked about its history I was told that most of the knowledge and culture of the people who built it was lost, with the arrival of the Europeans. Now it's turned into a rebuilt money making tourist trap, with the loss of its real meaning.

I recorded the space and sounds there with binaural mics, so I could try and capture some of the feeling of it, including a storm which came in, and then I wrote a strings part inspired by the feelings of the visit there. Tom Hodge brought the piece to life by playing a piano part in addition, and I loved the piano so much I decided to make two parts, the first with the piano only, combined with the binaural recordings and a randomising delay feedback network, and the second part with the strings. The first part of Teotihuacan is available exclusively from the free download Quotient Series, and the second part will be coming on the Artefact EP in April.

preorder available - www.smarturl.it/ArtefactEP‏

tracks.tag_list: Quotient Series Max Cooper Anatomic melodic glitch click techno house electronica human machine
tracks.title: Anatomic - Quotient 5/6
tracks.description:
I wanted part of my Emergence show to be about the emergence of the human machine, with an infographic-style visual tour of the different modules of the human body - lungs, heart, blood vessels, brain, and more. Henning M. Lederer, who created the amazing video to "Numb", took on the project and created some beautiful video content, and I then created the music to match.

Anatomic is now the fifth free download in the Quotient series - original pieces of music, remixes and mixes that are free just for you.

DOWNLOAD: http://bit.ly/CooperSound

Anatomic was created in an unusual way for me, as a scored part of my new Emergence audio-visual show.

Henning's work is hand drawn, and this video work was also colourful, so I made the music quite playful and lighter than my usual - to match the fun, but also full of meaning, visual content. This section of Emergence also shows the mechanical, ongoing, cyclical nature of the workings of the human body, so I applied the same reasoning to the music, with many melodic and rhythmical loops of different lengths and forms, which create interesting syncopation effects as they interact in a continuous flowing structure, without breaks or stops.

Anatomic is very much a piece of music most at home in the live show, I hope you can join me to see it sometime!

tracks.tag_list: "max cooper" "alex banks"
tracks.title: Eve - with Alex Banks - Quotient 6/6
tracks.description:
Here's Alex's and my oral history of this track..

Alex:  "The idea for ‘Eve’ came about from a short session in my studio where I sketched out some very rough 16 bar loops and sent them over to Max to play with, deliberately stopping myself from developing them too far at this stage in order to leave space the collaborative process to evolve."

Max:  "I almost un-wrote a track for this one. Alex started off with the main bulk of the ideas for the track, and I initially chopped it all back to a couple of key elements.   I then experimented with some FFT effects and building some chaotic randomising manipulations of the basic elements, and sliding drum rhythms so that one drum element would slip relative to another and then back in - all an attempt to generate some movement and variation from the simple building blocks."

Alex:   "It was interesting to hear the rough ideas I had created, developed in a totally different way to how they would have had I been writing the track by myself. Inspired by the new direction the track was going in - "

Max:  "I'd made a mess.  Alex helped tidy it all up and bring it enough back into line to work as a dancefloor track"

Alex:  "- I layered some more percussion hits and string textures.  We continued the process of sending stems back and forth, refining each others ideas as well and creating new ones until the track was ready."

Max:  "The quotient series has been a nice opportunity to experiment with new music outside of the restrictions of record labels and their need to sell product.  This freedom has left me open to put out a piano solo and feedback matrix, a 10 minute ambient to drum and bass glitch remix, a track scored to a video, a one off club collab and more - all projects that I wanted to try, and am glad I did, but that wouldn't easily fit into the usual EP/LP formats. 

It's been a sort of sketch and experiment project, much of it tied to the Emergence visual shows, where I've been experimenting with how I can perform music and visual in sync in a live format. "

Thanks for listening - and thanks to everyone who's come to Emergence this year!

Max.

tracks.tag_list: Electronic tileyard improvisations gearbox records vinyl "max cooper"
tracks.title: Chronology - with Quentin Collins, Kathrin deBoer and Jack Stevens
tracks.description:
What happens if you take 3 great jazz musicians, put them in recording studio, and throw electronic music at them?

This project was an experiment into exactly that, with my long running collaborator Kathrin deBoer on vocals, and the greatest trumpet player I've yet to hear - Quentin Collins, with Jack Stevens on bass for this one track from the EP too. 

We made some recordings where Kathrin and Quentin played at the same time, which was really interesting - I love the way you can hear Kathrin and Quentin almost talking to each other during the track, they sort of imitate and bounce off each other as they go along. They were having a lot of fun during the recordings and I think it comes through.

The fun we were having making the recordings was aided by the fact that Gearbox records (who are releasing the EP 6th Oct on vinyl, and 3rd Nov on digital) had provided Mark Ronson's recording studio for us to work in, so it was a pleasure all round.

There are 3 more tracks to come from the release, 2 ambient, and one absolute abomination where I wanted to see what would happen if I made the most f*&ked up track I could and then asked them to improvise over it - more clips and info coming soon.

If you want to catch Quentin Collins playing, he does regular gigs in London at Ronnie Scotts, amongst other places. And Kathrin deBoer has also launched a new solo project under her name, which is also touring and highly recommended.

tracks.tag_list: "tom hodge" "max cooper" artefact Ep fields piano beautiful Electronic electronica post classical Atmospheric
tracks.title: Remnants - with Tom Hodge - Preview Clip
tracks.description:
I've been working on some new music with Tom Hodge, combining piano and electronic elements - the first track preview is below, with the full release coming 20th April.

For this track we made the drums from clanging around inside a broken piano, and then applying some complex editing, so they have an interesting partially live feel, even though rhythmically they are very electronic.

The piano came from a live jam over an initial chord structure, then lots of editing to find that one simple little hook in there. It felt like a reflective piece of music to me, invoking memories, so we chose "remnants". Nick Cobby has taken the concept further with an amazing music video, coming soon!

Pre-order the EP or get Remnants now > http://hyperurl.co/MCartefactEP

tracks.tag_list: frahm nils max cooper electronica juno for remix
tracks.title: Nils Frahm - For - Max Cooper remix
tracks.description:
Nils Frahm is one of the best artists out there in my opinion, with pretty much the best live show I've ever seen. But aside from all that, this was just a really enjoyable remix to work on because the original is such a great piece of music, and seemingly so well suited to what I wanted to do with it - which was to try and turn Nils' instrumental jam on his Juno, into something house/techno/club/44 compatible, but still carrying the class and feeling of the original. It was one of those remixes that just seemed to fit and flow easily, with minimum strain and maximum enjoyment on my part - usually a good sign for a remix (the one's that have to be forced never seem to quite get there).

Not only is this one of the best remix projects I've been lucky enough to be involved with, it's also available totally free for you to download and share as you like, courtesy of Erased Tapes and Decibel festival where myself and Nils played last weekend, as well as XLR8R, who were good enough to first feature it at at http://www.xlr8r.com/news/2013/10/download-max-coopers-new-remix-n

And of course, it's also a thank you to YOU for listening an supporting my work over the years....thank you and I hope you like the track!.... 

ps if you're in London on the 18th, Nils is playing an Erased Tapes showcase at Village Underground.

tracks.tag_list: electronica Vocal Chill Deep soft "max cooper" fields kindred Ep
tracks.title: Origins
tracks.description:
iTunes - http://smarturl.it/MCKindred
A few years ago I did a remix of a track by Dominik Eulberg called Sansula, which featured an instrument of the same name. After the release a builder of sansula instruments in the Netherlands was kind enough to give me one as a present in case I wanted to use one again in a live recording, which I have finally got around to doing now with this track!

My process consisted of me sitting in my studio (badly) playing the thumb plucked sansula for quite a while, so that I could go back to the recording and pull out some useable loops as a starting point. I wanted a nice warm analogue chord progression to complement, but more in the high bass and low mids than my usual chord progression that's down really low, to fill the mix with the warmth as much as possible.

The track still needed something though, so I turned to some spare recordings of my favourite vocalist - Kathrin deBoer, from some of our previous recording sessions. I didn't want to go for the usual full lyrical approach of a vocal collab track, I just wanted to add some small snippets of human feeling to round off the track properly.

The release is coming out on Fields on the 1st of December along with an intense synth experiment with a Prophet 08, and beautiful remixes from David August and Throwing Snow.

If you're not into buying music there is also a new website I have just launched which will be providing exclusive new free downloads for all in return for signing up to the website - http://www.maxcooper.net/downloads

tracks.tag_list: "max cooper" electronica techno classical glitch piano fields traum "nils frahm" lusine "tim hecker" burial "boards of canada" "drum and bass" bbc "radio 1" "pete tong" kiasmos "rob clouth"
tracks.title: Essential Mix - Max Cooper - No Voice Overs
tracks.description:
I've been listening to Essential mixes since I first started getting into clubs and electronic music, so it was a shock, and exciting for me, to get the offer to make one myself. The two hour format really allows some time to explore ideas musically as well.

So bringing everything together, I decided to try and make it an exploration of everything that has made me so obsessed with electronic music for the last 20 years, with some of my favourite records from the mid 90's, unreleased material from my favourite artists like Nils Frahm, Lusine, Tim Hecker and Rob Clouth, and a range of genres from ambient to 90 bpm electronica, house and techno, all the way up to 170bpm glitched jungle mayhem - I thought, why not have some fun with it!?

So it's certainly not a normal club mix, it's just what I think is the best music out there, without worrying about what genre or box any particular track fits into or how things should be done "properly". I wanted to leave some sections quite ambient as well, to give breathing space between the peaks, so I'm happy to be able to post this new version up, minus the broadcast talking and idents.

The mix also contains some new work from me, some unreleased, and two tracks from my new EP with Tom Hodge, one of which you can download for free from here www.maxcooper.net, the other you can download from iTunes - http://hyperurl.co/MCartefactEP - or Beatport - http://btprt.dj/1DHZhHk

tracks.title: Origins
tracks.description:
iTunes - http://smarturl.it/MCKindred
A few years ago I did a remix of a track by Dominik Eulberg called Sansula, which featured an instrument of the same name. After the release a builder of sansula instruments in the Netherlands was kind enough to give me one as a present in case I wanted to use one again in a live recording, which I have finally got around to doing now with this track!

My process consisted of me sitting in my studio (badly) playing the thumb plucked sansula for quite a while, so that I could go back to the recording and pull out some useable loops as a starting point. I wanted a nice warm analogue chord progression to complement, but more in the high bass and low mids than my usual chord progression that's down really low, to fill the mix with the warmth as much as possible.

The track still needed something though, so I turned to some spare recordings of my favourite vocalist - Kathrin deBoer, from some of our previous recording sessions. I didn't want to go for the usual full lyrical approach of a vocal collab track, I just wanted to add some small snippets of human feeling to round off the track properly.

The release is coming out on Fields on the 1st of December along with an intense synth experiment with a Prophet 08, and beautiful remixes from David August and Throwing Snow.

If you're not into buying music there is also a new website I have just launched which will be providing exclusive new free downloads for all in return for signing up to the website - http://www.maxcooper.net/downloads

title: Kindred EP

description:
INHUMAN ONE out now on Fields > http://www.beatport.com/release/inhuman-one/1280972

So, I did an album, and it was time to find some remixers, so I got in touch with a few of my absolute favourite producers in the world, and luckily for me, some of them were interested in getting involved with the release. In fact, we ended up with such a great bunch of remixes, we decided to split them into two packages, so we could all take in each one of their works with enough time for the proper consideration they deserve.

This time we have Lusine, Rodriguez Jr and Harvey McKay. Lusine is one of my all-time-favourite producers, and has been for many years. His "A Certain Distance" LP being one of the most listened to albums in my collection, and his use of detail, complexity, warm synths and beautiful melodies, a big inspiration for me over the years.

Rodriguez Jr has always featured heavily in my DJ sets, with his soft and massive at the same time productions, and a knack for writing tracks that seem to work anywhere in the world and on any sound system - that is f'ing hard to do!....He's a master of tight productions, as demonstrated by his beautiful remix of Supine on this release - hats off to Olivier.

Harvey McKay has basically stamped on everyone in the last year or two (in the best possible way!) with his brand of crunchy saturated techno hugeness. He's got some amazing way of making this rolling wall of sound that's got aggression and groove in a lovely balance - if you ever hear this remix of his on a big system it all becomes clear!

tracks.title: Woven Ancestry - Lusine Remix
tracks.description:
Out Now! >> http://www.beatport.com/release/inhuman-one/1280972

Lusine has been one of my favourite producers for a long time. I'm just going back over some of his first releases on Ghostly International from the early 00's, and it's amazing how ahead of the game he's always been. His combination of delicate productions and beautiful warm analogue melodies, intricacies and amazing shuffling grooves have been a big inspiration for me over the years, with his "A certain distance" album from 2009 being one of my all-time most listened too albums.

So Lusine was one of my ideal remixers for the album, and thanks to Sean at Decibel festival, the hookup was made and he was into the idea. He's turned out a beautiful remix of Woven Ancestry, which if you've seen me play recently, you probably heard in my set. The mix has special balance of being a great piece of music to listen to at home, but then when it's unleashed in a club it's groove takes on a whole new life which I hadn't seen coming until I tried it out - Thanks Jeff!

Max

title: Inhuman One

description:
Available from: http://www.beatport.com/release/impacts/1228072

So, it's my next album single, and this time it's a bit crunching. There is a reason for this abomination lacking softness or melody though - the album is called "Human", and it's my attempt to translate some common themes about the human condition, into musical form. And of course not everything about being human is beautiful or pleasant - we experience all sorts of things, and this one is about the impacts of life, in the form of pounding mechanical collisions. It's a club track really, and if you've seen me in recent months you've probably had your face smashed by it a little - sorry about that!

Big thanks to Pitchfork for featuring this along with the amazing acid-style excursion from Gabe Gurnsey of Factor Floor.....AND....watch out for the Perc mix coming very soon, which takes the track to whole new labels of abrasion.

Here is the press spiel in case more info and fafferage is needed -

An album that sets out to examine sonic extremes, Max Cooper's debut Human juxtaposes a whole range of electronic styles: lush orchestration fighting savage distortion, and clinical digital sound anchored by warm analogue grooves. And nowhere is that restless curiosity to experiment as apparent as the contrast of the first and second singles - first, the delicate and downtempo Adrift, versus this second release, Impacts, the roughest, toughest sampler workout Cooper has produced.
On the album, they're sequenced in a focused line to be the centre of the album's first act and then its midpoint, before the album's more experimental final act. But as a single on its own? Impacts is a stop-start stomper that has had festival crowds asking WTF!?!? for months now, and the album's only purely dancefloor moment - as far from voguish k-house sounds as it is.

But despite the harsh uncompromising sonic contrast - and this is a track that grunts into focus like a sledgehammer picking a fight with a gang of hi-hats - Impacts is, to Cooper's mind, actually something very optimistic. It's the sound of a person beaten again and again by life, but each time bouncing back and wanting more.

For the remixes, Cooper has gone for two artists with their own take on high-contrast sonics. Gabe Gurnsey of Factory Floor has folded his band's hypnotic acid tweaking into the original's rasping beats, and Perc has gone balls out with an take-it-or-leave it experimental sub-lead mix for the serious heads and big systems.

 11 comments

title: Impacts

description:
I've been enjoying experimenting with combinations of classical elements with electronics recently, so I was really happy to get the opportunity to work with the great pianist and composer Tom Hodge, to see where we could go with the fusion. The result is the new Fragmented Self EP, which is out now on Fields.

We explored a few different possibilities ranging from the attempt to fuse extreme opposites in the title track Fragments of Self, to the distorted mayhem of falling off a cliff, and Quantet, where I chopped Tom’s orchestral session into tiny pieces and built something unnatural.

The EP comes with a remix from one of my favourite artists at the moment – Petrels, if you don’t know his stuff already I highly recommend a listen. He’s done an amazing job on the remix of Fragments of Self, stripping away those nasty glitches and getting down to the nice stuff in a really live organic sort of way.

The EP comes in two parts, with the second part coming in a few weeks, AND, a music video from Nick Cobby for Fragements of Self, which is pretty stupendous (that good!). I hope you like some of this new work.
tag_list: max cooper tom hodge fragmented self ep fields london contemporary post classical modern electornica glitch techno piano

tracks.tag_list: "Max Cooper" "Tom Hodge" Fragments Self EP Fragmented Piano Modern Post Classical Glitch Techno Ambient Extremes Opposites Combined
tracks.title: Fragments of Self - with Tom Hodge - Out Now on FIELDS
tracks.description:
This track is about emergence from the combination of polar opposites. Fragments of self from very different places, but part of the same whole.

Combining classical and computational elements is something I've been experimenting with for some years, but this attempt to combine the extreme opposites of each was spurred on by some chance DJing experiments, a fortuitous collaboration opportunity, and the amazing work of my friends Olafur Arnalds and Vaetxh (Rob Clouth). I found that I could mix the most beautiful and delicate piano solo of Olafur, with the most hyper-edited and jarring glitch of Vaetxh, and that the result actually worked, well, for me anyway, even if half the people in the club stood confused about how to dance. So when the opportunity arose to work with the pianist and composer Tom Hodge, I wanted to try and create this form of merger of extremes for a release, rather than it being confined to my DJ toolbox (also on the classical meets glitch history from a slightly different angle, check out "Rossz Csillag Alatt Született" from Venetian Snares 2005!).

After some discussion of ideas and approach with Tom, he sat and played and made some recordings for me, which I then chopped and build chords and structure around, sent them back to him to play over the top of again, and then back to me to edit and glitch the playing along with the nasty noises. My detailing process was that of finding some interesting sound sources (binaural recordings, drum hit samples, clangs and slams etc) and using some Max for live randomisation chains to generate lots of partially random complexity which I could then edit as audio before repeating the process with additional layers, eventually bringing the recorded piano audio in to the editing too.

At completion of the audio I was really happy to find out that Nick Cobby, one of my favourite video artists and long standing collaborator, was available and interested in working on the visual side of the project. He took the combination of seemingly incompatible opposites, and applied it visually with his beautiful generative forms, smooth and organic for the melodic sections, and jagged and abrasive for the percussive sections - big thanks to Nick for his amazing work as always!

So, that's probably enough ranting about this track from me, aside from why it is like it is, I hope it's something that you can enjoy irrespective of the conceptual faff.

tracks.tag_list: "Tom Hodge" Piano Remix Techno "Max Cooper"
tracks.title: Max Cooper & Tom Hodge - Fragments of Self (Petrels Remix)
tracks.description:
https://www.facebook.com/Petrels
http://petrels.bandcamp.com/
http://floatinglimb.com/
https://twitter.com/bowed_idly

Remix of the track 'Fragments of Self' from 'Fragmented Self' by Max Cooper and Tom Hodge.

http://www.fieldsldn.net/

When trying to make creative decisions based on the results of somebody else's process it makes you try things out that perhaps you wouldn't normally think of and I'd say with every remix I've ever done I've come away with something new.  Sometimes its interesting to take a track in a completely new direction but in the case of Max and Tom's collaboration I was immediately drawn to the subtle harmonic undercurrent of the synth lines beneath the main piano parts and figured it would be interesting to put together an arrangement that brought that to the fore. 

I started with a rough layering and overlay of the piano samples - trying to re-arrange them into different combinations than in the original to create something that had the same feel (on a side note, its always pleasing to work with recordings like this of instruments that sound played - i.e., you can hear the movement of the pedals and the fingers on the keys rather than a surgically-extracted sequence of notes) but that came to the main melodies from a different angle.  I can't really compete with Max's glitchy rhythmic production and since this is so distinctive it seemed like a bit of a cop-out to make too much use of these samples in any case so in the end the main part of what I used of the rhythm was a short kick drum sample that I processed in various ways to create the studded melodic cross-rhythm that I used for most of the middle of the track.

With the bare bones in place the majority of the rest of the work came from layering up the arrangement with the kinds of synths and strings that I make use of in my Petrels stuff.  Like I said, I was drawn to the low root synth line in the original that casts a subtle melodic shade over the piano lines so using this as a starting point I slowly built up the orchestration around it so as to make it much more of a focal point.  In the end, hopefully the result is something akin to a huge group of assorted musicians attempting a spontaneous live version of what essentially started as a duet performance. Well that was the idea anyhow.

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Tom Hodge Von Der Klippe Fallen Falling Off Cliff Saturation Heavy Techno Distortion Piano Classical Death
tracks.title: Von Der Klippe Fallen - with Tom Hodge - FIELDS
tracks.description:
This track is about having a walk on a nice sunny day in the countryside, all is well and good, until you accidentally fall off a cliff. We chose the title in Deutsch due to the kick focused poundingness rhythmically.

It was a fun track as I decided I'd let loose, and you might notice, particularly towards the end it gets pretty loose! But luckily Tom's beautiful 5 bar piano riff is there to anchor things at either end, and hopefully save you from the death by cliff (you might notice it's a pain to mix with those 5 bar loops though).

So a bit of background - Tom Hodge is a great pianist and composer who I met recently, and we've been working on lots of interesting things. This is the most extreme in terms of the noise levels really, we've done some nice stuff too, as we're not planning on starting a death metal band just yet.

Lot's more to hear from this collaboration with the release out on Monday 28th on Fields + an amazing remix from Petrels of the A-side track (Fragments of Self) + an amazing video for the A-side by Nick Cobby, which we're all really excited about!

Thanks for listening!

tracks.tag_list: max cooper tom hodge quantet fields fragmented self ep contemporary classical strings micro sampled techno melodic
tracks.title: Quantet - with Tom Hodge - FIELDS
tracks.description:
This track started with some interesting strings recordings Tom made, where he arranged the instruments in terms of their frequency range, from the lowest in the centre to the highest on the edges. He provided my with a few unused recordings of this session and I sort of brutalised them, in as much as the end result sounds nothing at all like the original recordings. I just liked the timbre and texture that occurred when I cut them up, with each hit being a complex mixture of chords, one bleeding into the other so that a lot of the samples are quite impure melodically.

It just turned into an experiment of what I could do with these odd melodic units, or quanta of the original tentet, hence the name - Quantet. In the end I went for a very simple stripped back approach, nothing too unexpected or complex in this one, but hopefully a nice mood, that was the aim anyway.

title: Max Cooper & Tom Hodge, Fragments of Self Part One

description:
As you probably already know from my constant rantings, Nils Frahm is one of my favourite artists, and no doubt the best live performer I've seen. I had the opportunity to remix his Juno EP, so I had a play with both tracks to see which one might work out best. The thing was though, both were amongst the most enjoyable remix projects I've ever worked on, because the original instrumentals on Nils' Juno were so rich and beautiful, and seemingly well suited to what I wanted to do with them. So in the end I remixed both tracks from the EP, resulting in the relaxed and easy to digest club format remix of "For", and the slightly more obscure, glitched and detailed remix of "Peter", with the two hopefully working as a pair as does the original Juno EP.

And now, courtesy of Erased Tapes, Decibel Festival, Dummy Magazine and XLR8R, and me too, you can have both remixes for absolute total free to download and share and post as you like - just hit the download button on the soundcloud player or page, with no need to visit a Russian mp3 store!

The original features on XLR8R and Dummy are here, thanks to both for featuring >>
http://www.xlr8r.com/news/2013/10/download-max-coopers-new-remix-n
http://www.dummymag.com/new-music/premiere-nils-frahm-peter-max-cooper-remix

And finally thank you for listening to my stuff over the years and supporting what I've been doing, I hope you like this freebie, it's probably the best thing I've worked on....strictly rubbish music to come from here on!

ps Nils is playing at village underground in London on th 18th October with Olafur and Rival Consoles - will be great no doubt, hopefully catch you there.
tag_list: Nils Frahm Juno Remixed For Peter Max Cooper free download erased tapes decibel festival

tracks.tag_list: "Nils Frahm" Juno Remixed Peter For "Erased Tapes" Reworked "Decibel Festival" "The Hydra" "Max Cooper"
tracks.title: Nils Frahm – Peter (Max Cooper Remix)
tracks.description:
In celebration of both artists performing in London this month, Max Cooper is offering this wonderful remix of his dear friend Nils Frahm, who'll perform an electronic set on October 18 as part of The Hydra: Erased Tapes label night at the Village Underground.

Tickets available via Resident Advisor: 
http://www.residentadvisor.net/event.aspx?517392

A second remix of Juno track 'For' can be downloaded via XLR8R:
http://www.xlr8r.com/news/2013/10/download-max-coopers-new-remix-n

In Max's own words:

'Nils Frahm is one of the best artists out there in my opinion, with pretty much the best live show I've ever seen. But aside from all that, this was just a really enjoyable remix to work on because the original is such a great piece of music, and seemingly so well suited to what I wanted to do with it - which was to try and turn Nils' instrumental jam on his Juno, into something house/techno/club/44 compatible, but still carrying the class and feeling of the original. It was one of those remixes that just seemed to fit and flow easily, with minimum strain and maximum enjoyment on my part - usually a good sign for a remix (the one's that have to be forced never seem to quite get there).

Not only is this one of the best remix projects I've been lucky enough to be involved with, it's also available totally free for you to download and share as you like, courtesy of Erased Tapes and Decibel festival where myself and Nils played last weekend, as well as XLR8R, who were good enough to first feature the 'For' remix.

And of course, it's also a thank you to YOU for listening an supporting my work over the years....thank you and I hope you like the track!....

ps if you're in London on the 18th, Nils is playing an Erased Tapes showcase at Village Underground.'

'Frahm's beautiful, clever piano melodies are a perfect match for Cooper's emotional, distinctive breed of production, blurring lines between the recital hall and the dance floor.' – Earmilk

description: Here is my second EP in the conditions series. For this one I worked with a great vocalist called Kathrin DeBoer, who you may know from a band called Belleruche. She has a really interesting voice, not the usual for electronic music. We just had a bit of a live jam and this is what came out, it's pretty rough around the edges, with the live improvised vocals straight in there on the finished track. I just liked the raw feeling that she caught from the sketches I had and the idea behind them, so we went with it as it happened, I hope you like it!

tracks.tag_list: max cooper feat kathrin deboer numb fields deep capitalist heavy 12 experimental electronica maxcooper machine
tracks.title: Max Cooper Feat. Kathrin deBoer - Numb - Extended Version (clip)
tracks.description:
This was a really fun project to work on right the way through. It started with some glitchy beats and a couple of big basslines I was messing around with, with a general idea of a deep but almost overpowering feeling. Kathrin came to my little studio in London and we talked a little about the idea, before she just let go and free-style sang over the loops, using my crappy little test mic I bought for 12 pounds in 2002.

The plan was to lay down some melodic ideas for the vocals, which I could then select, and send back to Kathrin to write lyrics with and re-record properly. But when I ran through everything after I released she'd just nailed it right then and there! All I had to do was layer up some of the multiple instances of her voice, and add my reverbs and widening with some subtle EQing and compression, and it was there - she captured the pure feeling of the music and enhanced it a million times, and I love the free-flowing feeling of it, with its imperfections and half words, and of course, he subconscious vocal of not feeling any more lead to the title and concise concept for the music.

We knew that we had to get a video made to match Kathrin's work, and I was really excited to find out that Henning M. Lederer, who I had been a big fan of for some time, could do the project. We discussed options together and decided to try a "numbed by the capitalist machine" theme, which he has developed into an amazing, detailed story with a twist. I love the result, I hope it works for you too! - The video will be released in a few days, I'll put the link HERE when it's ready!

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Falling into Recursive Space Fields Melodic Deep Electronica Techno Paradox Belleruche Kathrin deBoer
tracks.title: Max Cooper Feat. Kathrin deBoer - Falling Into Recursive Space (clip)
tracks.description:
This is the second idea I worked on with Kathrin deBoer for the Conditions Two EP, and an attempt to make something surreal. I tried to use her voice as an instrument in the track, rather than presenting it as a normal vocal at the forefront of the mix. I used lots of Max for Live fiddling’s to mangle up her vocals into all sorts of weird noises, and then picked out some of my favourites to use in the track. Most of the noises that aren’t the drums and main synths, so pretty much all the weird noises in the track, are made from Kathrin’s voice.



The overall feeling was something soft and organic, where in addition to the unpredictability and non-loopy manner of the vocal effects, the drums also follow a loose and slightly randomised pattern, with lots of shuffle to add to the free feeling. I thought the approach made it end up sounding a bit maddening and messy, and there was also a strong feeling of space in there with the main pads, so this combined with the surrealist approach lead me to the name ‘Falling Into Recursive Space’.

title: Conditions Two

description:
So, here is my latest experiment on Traum Schallplatten!

This EP is themed with movements through different mediums, and for two of the tracks I worked with Nicolas Bougaieff, one of the founders of Liine (who make Lemur, Griid, Remiix and other great music apps).

Fracture is about moving though fractured space. Meadows is about moving through some nice warm summer fields. Ellipse is about moving though ellipses, and Walls is about moving through walls of sound.

So there you go, I hope there's something in there you like - there's also great remixes from Microtrauma, Logiztik Sounds and Nyma, plus an amazing video, finally, with the return of Whiskas FX (Andrew Brewer) which will be released any day soon!

Out now digital + vinyl
tag_list: Max Cooper Nicolas Bougaieff Movements EP Traum Schallplatten

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Nicolas Bougaieff Fracture Movements EP Traum Schallplatten Melodic Big Noise Techno Sound Design
tracks.title: Max Cooper and Nicolas Bougaieff - Fracture (out now)
tracks.description:
Continuing with the theme of the Movements EP, this one is about movement through fractured space. We used Nick's great operator patch again (the same one as for Ellipse), and Nick came up with this nice riff. I mainly just made lots of strange noises and worked on the drums, automation, arrangement, details and overall feel, trying to keep it pretty simple and too the point - that is a nice flowing club style with plenty of broken reality moments.

This one has a really straight groove, with all the drums quite quantised to a linear grid, while Ellipse uses some of the same elements with a heavy shuffled groove - you can hear the really different club feel that results in the two tracks.

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Meadows Sunshine Modern Classical Electronica Melodic Traum Schallplatten
tracks.title: Max Cooper - Meadows
tracks.description:
This track is contained on the Movements EP, where each track is themed by movement through a different medium. The concept I had in mind this time was a summer meadow, with lots of warmth and activity and detail of all natural processes going on, and a feeling of movement though the space. I have no idea how well that idea of mine translates into the piece of music for you, but hopefully it works in some way (your interpretation is more important than my concept really).

Andrew Brewer (Whiskas FX) has made a video for this one with some abstracted meadows combined with moire patterns, it's a beauty!....can't wait to get that out in the next few days.

(This is just a clip of the track btw, if you want the full length version it will be out 1st April!)

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Walls of Sound Movements EP Traum Schallplatten Full Techno Distortion Minimal
tracks.title: Max Cooper - Walls
tracks.description: The EP is about movements through different mediums, this one being about movements through walls of sound. So I've put a really simple beat structure on there with a maddeningly repetitive two note acid style riff to try and lull people into some sort of brain dead state before they hit the wall, and exit out the other side wondering what just happened. That's the idea anyway, a track of maximised contrasts, it works great in a club, maybe not so much of home listener, see what you think anyway!

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Nicolas Bougaieff Ellipse Traum Schallplatten Melodic Techno
tracks.title: Max Cooper and Nicolas Bougaieff - Ellipse
tracks.description:
For my new EP on Traum I've done a couple of collaborative tracks with Nicolas Bougaieff (one of the founders of Liine). Nick had some great melodic ideas and a nice operator patch which we used to build two tracks around. This first one, Ellipse, has lots of shuffle and a simple groove to focus attention on the meandering riff at forefront. It's a little different from my usual, a bit of an experiment, hopefully some people will like it!

Release date 1st April on Traum, digital + 12"

tracks.title: Max Cooper Feat. BRAIDS - Automaton
tracks.description:
The concept for this one is about our nature as deterministic biological machines, unable to escape from our natural responses and behaviour finely tuned by millions of years of evolution, and now quite out of sync with the modern world we live in. The lyrics "I can't stop it" were the starting point for the concept, and I attempted to create a robotic-like sequences from chopped BRAIDS vocals to further present the idea.

Two more points to note, this one comes with an amazing remix from Ghosting Season, which I recommend you check out straight away! And also this track is available in interactive music video App form for iPhone and iPad on the App store!

https://itunes.apple.com/gb/app/automaton-max-cooper/id547916685?mt=8

tracks.title: Max Cooper Feat. BRAIDS - Pleasures
tracks.description: BRAIDS are one of my favourite bands, so when I had the chance to work with them I jumped on it. The vocals were the starting point, which I layered and used to generate a general feeling also in fitting with the lyrics, which then defined how I built the rest of the tracks around them. The first one from the EP is "Pleasures", for which I wanted to make something positive and warming, with nice straightforward drums and nothing too harsh in terms of builds and drops, just a delicate flow to give a pleasurable listening experience, hopefully!

title: Conditions One

description: Here is my latest EP on Traum, with three tracks typical of my work on the label, but bring in some different flavour on the Aside with a live-drum-driven techno track that's been doing the job nicely in my shows of recent. Then there's a relaxed ambient on - Gravity Well, and silly bassline activities on Basal Ganglia! It's out today on digital and 12", along with an excellent remix from Microtrauma, I hope there's something in there you like!
tag_list: Max Cooper Inflections EP Traum Schallplatten

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Spiral Inflections EP Traum Schallplatten
tracks.title: Max Cooper - Spiral Inflections (clip)
tracks.description: I wanted to make something a bit different from my usual with some sort of flowing dancefloor appeal here, starting with using live drum loops rather than my usual programmed drums, and a flowing up and down bassline. I then added some melodic hits in several layers each of different loop lengths, which go up or down in syncopating rhythms, sounding to me like they spiral in and out of one another, with tight spiral points and longer curves, hence the name and artwork!

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Gravity Well Inflections EP Traum Schallplatten Deep Ambient Techno
tracks.title: Max Cooper - Gravity Well (clip)
tracks.description: For this one I wanted to make something soft and enveloping that puts a sort of heavy relaxed feeling onto the listener, with the clicks and subtle rhythm to carry it along. A gravity well is an area of space that is warped by a large mass, looking something like a well in 2D representations hence the the name, and an area of space where you would feel the inescapable heavy pull of gravity all over your body, which was the feeling I was trying to produce with the track - For the mass I was thinking something a bit heavier than the earth, but not so heavy as to be painful. This one has a video on the way too, following the same concept, that should be ready this week!

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Basal Ganglia Inflections EP Traum Schallplatten Silly Techno
tracks.title: Max Cooper - Basal Ganglia (preview clip)
tracks.description: This track is a bit of a joke, I just wanted to make something a bit odd and noisy for the dancefloor, something that would slap everyone round the face a bit to wake them up and put a smile on their face with some sillyness. Hence the silly name too, which is a real part of the brain, but one I always thought sounded funny.

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper emix Michael Nyman David McAlmont Secrets Accusations and Charges Last Night on On Earth Sasha Traum Classical Electronica R Reconstruction
tracks.title: Michael Nyman - Secrets - Max Cooper Reconstruction
tracks.description:
Michael Nyman & David McAlmont - Secrets Accustions & Charges - Max Cooper Deconstruction/Reconstruction

I wrote these two remixes as a pair, starting only with two audio files, one orchestral part of all the strings, piano etc, and one vocal part of David McAlmont singing. It wasn't easy to tame the parts into an electronic format that I was happy with, so I opted to cut everything up into tiny segments and reconstruct my own track which ended up really different from the original - my "Deconstruction" mix. Then I was faced with the problem of exactly that, that the remix sounded nothing like the original, so I then tried to reconstruct back to the original from the parts I had made - my "Reconstruction" mix. It was an interesting production exercise I guess, not an easy remix job, but hopefully it yielded something interesting.

It's out now on Last Night on Earth!

And Nick Cobby has amazed me with his video for the tracks, it's really amazing - He invited people to be 3d mapped at his studio, and then cut there digitised face footage perfectly to the segments of audio I used to create the music - you gotta watch it!! >> http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=khlLc7NNOok

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Fisted Mechanical Concussion EP Herzblut Stephan Bodzin Brutal Industrial Glitch Techno
tracks.title: Max Cooper & Jeet - Fisted (preview clip)
tracks.description:
This track is a reference back to old days when me and Jeet used to be residents at the Firefly club night in Nottingham. We used to do this 6 deck show with all sorts of turntablism and on-the-fly bootlegs and stuff like that, back when people still were interested in what you could do with some turntables and mixers. Jeet had this particular bootleg idea layering up some snare driven tracks, which we then recorded and glitched up - it was a monster!....so,  years later we realised that we should try and create an original track in that format, and this is the result - something of a reminder of Xircus/Thrash Jelly, and the mayhem of the closing set at the Garvey. And also a sound which is hopefully relevant now with the kick-focused groove, and in fitting with my other work via the glitch aspect. It was a lot of fun to work on, and is no doubt the hardest track I've ever made, if you're into my deep melodic stuff then I suggest you don't listen as you might be offended!

Release date is 280612 on Stephan Bodzin's Herzblut label, with the Bside track "Ruptured". My manager was a bit concerned I might offend people with the EP tracks "Fisted" and "Ruptured", but I think the music itself is a bit offensive too so the titles will hopefully be fitting at least. I wanted to call the whole package "Thrust" EP, haha, but that was deemed going too far, so we settled on "Mechanical Concussion" EP, to focus a little more on the industrial aspect. So there you go, turn it up as loud as you can bare and see what side you come down on!

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Ruptured Herzblut Mechanical Concussion EP Stephan Bodzin
tracks.title: Max Cooper - Ruptured (preview clip)
tracks.description:
I wanted to make something really heavy for this one, and for the whole "Mechanical Concussion" EP, as the name might suggest! This one is the B-side for the release, which will be coming on vinyl and digital on Stephan Bodzin's Herzblut label at the end of this month.

So yeah, it's a bit of heavy triplet marching style drums here, and some big distortion with a little Mrimba riff over the top. Maybe it's a bit scarey, but I captured the aggression I was after at least. Also beware when mixing this track, it's triplets so won't sit nicely over most 44 tunes!....It'll mix a treat with my Fairmont and Cream Sound remixes though

tracks.tag_list: Semiosis "Max Cooper" Dj Set Quotient Series number 2 of 6
tracks.title: Semiosis - DJ Set - Free DL - Quotient 2/6
tracks.description:
I’ve been pretty obsessed with simple ratios in the forms of chord progressions for as long as I can remember, hence all the long sustained chords in my music - for some reason I find chords even more satisfying in the lower frequencies, maybe we can pick out the ratios more clearly when they’re using slower wave fronts like with bass. I also love melodies and rhythms that combine different loop lengths so that interesting syncopation effects arise as a result of the ratios between the loop lengths. A lot of my favourite new tracks recently have used these types of techniques, so I decided to base a mix around them - Semiosis.

Semiosis is a process by which we create meaning from comparison. If I tell you a made up word that doesn’t relate to anything you know, you can get little meaning from it - meaning comes from what something isn’t, how it relates to other things you know. Music works in exactly this way, with us comparing meaningless wave frequencies to find feeling in how one value relates to another - a ratio.

Whether or not you like it, your subconscious mind is a massive maths geek, and it gets really excited when it finds a 1:3:5 ratio in the stream of air pressure information being received by your ears.  Ratio has the capacity to make us feel and make us dance. But it all happens without us being aware of it. 

When you listen to long drawn out chords and syncopating rhythms however, you can’t really get the full feeling from just a quick dip in, I find that it needs time for the ratios to wash over and sink in. The more time you give to it the more beauty you can find hidden in there. So the mix is very much of this long form, it doesn’t jump from one extreme to another like some of my other mixes, and needs to have some time to develop.

This is part 2 of 6 from the Quotient Series, all of which can be downloaded for free in return for signing up to my new download website, built specifically for bringing you new original tracks, remixes and mixes, which you won't be able to get from anywhere else. 

You can find the website here: http://bit.ly/CooperSound

tracks.title: Max Cooper Live - Fluid Landscapes - mix for Clash
tracks.description:
From the original feature on Clash Magazine: http://www.clashmusic.com/features/fluid-landscapes-exclusive-max-cooper-mix

It’s been a long time since I’ve made a full length “live” mix of just my own material, mainly because I was focused on my album in recent times. But after some new studio additions and work developing new ideas and new experiments, I’ve got enough fresh material to draw on, along with some old, to put together a new live set only composed of my originals, some remixes I’ve done, and I had to include a couple from the Inhuman remix package because there’s some great work on there from Lusine and Rodriguez Jr. among others.

I’ve approached this mix a little more like my live sets of old, keeping it pretty smooth and letting the tracks do the talking, rather than going too heavy on the genre-swapping and BPM-juggling as I have been doing on other mixes recently. There’s still some (hopefully) unexpected moments though of course, a strings solo, some crunchy glitch, backwards Nyatiti, several brand new never heard before tracks, a homemade desolation bootleg of Spastik, my first ever totally analogue tracks (I’ve only recently taken the plunge into the analogue synth world), and two live Jazz improvisation sessions recorded recently in London.

The artwork embedded is made by Andre Britz, who has literally created some "fluid landscapes" works, of which he was kind enough to donate a custom piece for this mix - Thanks Andre! You can find him here: https://www.behance.net/Andre

As a whole, the mix is about being wrapped up in a warm exploration of feelings and landscapes. It will work best with a nice pair of headphones and an open mind. I hope there’s at least some parts in there you enjoy!

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper DJ Set Soundscape Mix Ambient Binaural Recordings Field Tibetan Monks Gregorian Chant Techno Electronica Ancient Historic Modern Architectural Space British Museum Synesthetes Visual MMOTHS Bonobo Rrose Frahm Hopkins
tracks.title: Max Cooper - Synesthetes Museum (free download)
tracks.description:
From the feature in Magnetic Magazine
http://www.magneticmag.com/2013/04/sounds-spaces-001-max-cooper-the-british-museum/

Sounds & Spaces 001
Max Cooper - Synesthetes Museum
A mix based on the British Museum
 
Featuring a mix of 12th century Tibetan monks song, one of the first ever recordings of music, made by Thomas Edison on a wax cylinder in 1888, poetic spoken word, 9th century Gregorian Chant, A call to the lama from afar, some unreleased exclusives, 9/8 techno, traditional Chinese music mixed with rude glitch, and a binaural museum.
______________________________________



The brief for this mix was to make something inspired by an architectural space. When I was doing my Post-Doc at UCL I used to go the British Museum to relax, and work in the beautiful library there, so I chose the space for the mix. I wanted to capture the ambient atmosphere in the central courtyard, so I did some binaural recording to include in the mix. I also wanted to make the mix something of an exploration through history and ideas in line with the contents of the museum, so I brought in lots of disparate music spanning the centuries and continents. I also mixed it in a way to be like a journey though the museum, turning corners and regularly coming across something totally different and unexpected, with each track being like a different exhibit. Hence the name of the mix, in that, each piece of music almost has a visual content.

For the full track list + more information see the feature:
http://www.magneticmag.com/2013/04/sounds-spaces-001-max-cooper-the-british-museum/

My approach for this mix was defined by the fact that I had to do it while travelling for my Americas tour. So I picked out a selection of my favourite tracks before leaving, and was constrained to use only these. The difficulty was that I had chosen a load of different genres, so it turned into a puzzle of how to fit them all together into some sort of coherent flow. It was a good way to work in the end as it encouraged me to make edits of lots of the tracks, and also lead to some nice unexpected combinations.

This podcast will be very different from my set on the day, that will include all my favourite stuff from over the years, while this set is more of a preview and demo of my recent productions. My latest Egomodal EP on Traum features heavily, along with some recent remixes of Agoria, FC Kahuna and Phil Kieran which I've been playing out a lot recently. I hope you enjoy it!

title: Max Cooper Free Downloads

description: This is my latest EP for Traum, out 2nd April 2012 along with remixes from three of my favourite producers - Marc Romboy, Ripperton and Rone!...hope you like it.
tag_list: Max Cooper Egomodal EP Traum Schallplatten

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Micron Traum Schallplatten Egomodal EP Melodic Techno
tracks.title: Max Cooper - Micron (preview)
tracks.description: For this one I wanted to make something soft and deep and enveloping, but still with that techno compatibility, so I went with a simple rhythmical structure and long drawn out pads and chords, with some singing of single notes which I layered on top of each other to make some sort of vocal texture.

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Raw Egomodal EP Traum Schallplatten Aggression Ruptured Distorted Electronica Techno
tracks.title: Max Cooper - Raw (preview)
tracks.description: I was pretty frustrated when I wrote this track, because I was working on the EP for Traum and I couldn't seem to make anything "big" enough....So this is what happened! There is none of the details or intricacies that I usually try to make, instead I stripped the track back completely, and focused only on a small number of key elements which I tried to make as big and nasty as possible, hence why I called it Raw. It will be released in April, vinyl presales already available.

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Autumn Haze Egomodal EP Traum Schallplatten Melodic 44
tracks.title: Max Cooper - Autumn Haze (preview)
tracks.description: This is the A2 track from my new vinyl on Traum Schallpatten - It's a restrained melodic track which I tried to keep pure to it's concept, which was when I was sitting in my studio in Autumn, looking out the windows at the trees and nature which was clouded in mist. It had a really nice atmosphere which I tried to capture.

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Simplexity Egomodal EP Traum Schallplatten Simplicity Complexity Electronica Bass
tracks.title: Max Cooper - Simplexity (preview)
tracks.description: For this track I wanted to combine simplicity and complexity, so I went for a simple broken beat structure and bassline, and then used lots of Max for Live shenanigans to modulate the drums and hats and vocals in an interesting way, playing with psychoacoustics and detail as much as I could. It's a bit of a weird one, but I've been playing it out a lot and it seems to work!

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Epitaphy Egomodal EP Traum Schallplatten
tracks.title: Max Cooper - Epitaphy (preview)
tracks.description: This is the next track from my new EP coming out next month on Traum. I'm not quite sure how to place this one, it seems to split opinions, personally it's my least favourite track from the new EP, but the label liked it best and wanted it as the Aside. It seems to work well when I play it at out at least, it will be interesting to see how it goes down now with the first preview clip.

title: Max Cooper - Egomodal EP - Traum Schallplatten

description: This is an EP of collaborative and remix work, hence the name, an amalgamation of ideas of my own and of two of my favourite acts - Hiatus and Get People. It's out 071111 on Last Night on Earth!
tag_list: Max Cooper Amalgamations EP Last Night On Earth

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Feat Featuring Get People Careless Last Night on Earth Sasha
tracks.title: Max Cooper Feat. Get People - Careless
tracks.description: You might remember this track from a while back - it was originally a remix I did for the band, Get People, which wasn't programmed for official release, so I thought that the situation better be rectified and I went back to the track and updated it, and it was lucky enough to find a home on Sasha's new Last Night on Earth label. It's going out as a collaborative release rather than a straight remix because it's deviated quite far from the original, and also because it forms a more consistant solo release that way. I hope you like it!

tracks.tag_list: Hiatus Third Max Cooper Remix
tracks.title: Hiatus - Third - Max Cooper Remix
tracks.description: I had a modern classical/electronica mix from a friend (JamBon) which I had been listening to a lot, and after a weekend away the original of this track was really stuck in my head. At some point I clicked that it sounded just like the style of another friend - Hiatus, and on checking, it was him! So I got straight on email to him asking if I could have the parts, and I even got started on the remix before they arrived by buying the mp3 and starting to lay some ideas around that - When it's on I find it's best to go with it. It was a really enjoyable remix to do given how beautiful the original parts are, my mix is quite similar really, as I couldn't improve on it melodically, I've just tried to add some of my own flavour and twists.

title: Max Cooper - Amalgamations EP

description: Out now on Stephan Bodzin's Herzblut label along with an ace remix from Super Flu!

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Epoch Miocene EP Herzblut Stephan Bodzin
tracks.title: Epoch (preview clip)
tracks.description: Some discordant mayhem blips here. It's the Bside track off my forthcoming EP on Stephan Bodzin's Herzblut imprint. It will be released on vinyl 19th oct and digital 21th oct along with an awesome Super Flu remix of the Aside!

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Miocene EP Herzblut Stephan Bodzin
tracks.title: Miocene (preview)
tracks.description: This is the Aside from my forthcoming EP on Stephan Bodzin's Herzblut label, which will be out on vinyl + digital, along with an awesome remix from Super Flu. It's pretty simple on the whole, with a big wobbly bassline and some basic melody, but I've tried some slightly more experimental drum programming to hopefully keep it interesting. Really it's just meant for smashing out in a club though!

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Industrialiser Miocene EP Herzblut Stephan Bodzin
tracks.title: Industrialiser (preview clip)
tracks.description: This is the 3rd track off my forthcoming EP on Stephan Bodzin's label - Herzblut. I wanted to make something glitchy and sleazy here, no nice melodies to be heard....exactly the opposite!

title: Miocene EP - Herzblut

description: A selection of Max Cooper tracks for X-agency management web page

tracks.tag_list: Hiatus Third Max Cooper Remix
tracks.title: Hiatus - Third - Max Cooper Remix
tracks.description: I had a modern classical/electronica mix from a friend (JamBon) which I had been listening to a lot, and after a weekend away the original of this track was really stuck in my head. At some point I clicked that it sounded just like the style of another friend - Hiatus, and on checking, it was him! So I got straight on email to him asking if I could have the parts, and I even got started on the remix before they arrived by buying the mp3 and starting to lay some ideas around that - When it's on I find it's best to go with it. It was a really enjoyable remix to do given how beautiful the original parts are, my mix is quite similar really, as I couldn't improve on it melodically, I've just tried to add some of my own flavour and twists.

tracks.tag_list: Hot Chip I Feel Better Max Cooper Remix
tracks.title: Hot Chip - I Feel Better - Max Cooper Remix (Clip)
tracks.description: A remix of hot chip which is coming out this summer on vinyl with a Florien Meindl + Xircus mix in addition! ps Check out the unofficial youtube video someone has made to accompany the track! http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Tr1LfBtRlk

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Solace Traum Schallplatten Metaphysical EP Melodic Techno Electronica Jibbly Noises
tracks.title: Solace (Clip)
tracks.description: This track is released 4th April on Traum on vinyl and digital as part of the Metaphysical EP. It's quite heavy on the effects, with a long wierd noise intro just for the craic! I've been starting quite a few sets with it recently, but if you want to mix it I guess you just have to start a couple of minutes in.

tracks.tag_list: FC Kahuna Hayling Max Cooper Remix Skint
tracks.title: FC Kahuna - Hayling - Max Cooper Remix - Radio Edit
tracks.description: This is one of those tracks that seems to hold a lot of memories for people I think, having been a significant mainstream track when it was released in 2002, and also a beautiful piece of music by any standards - it's one of those ones you may not remember from the name, but when you listen the riff and vocal (by none other than Hafdis Huld) it's unmistakable. It even reached no. 49 in the UK charts according to Wikipedia, so I'm officially remixing pop music now (sort of). As with some of my other recent remixes, there was no need (and I probably would have found it impossible anyway) to improve on the track melodically, as it's pretty close to perfection in that sense. I just tried to update the style of it, with some glitchy detailed drums, a sort of dubstep-ish influenced beat structure, a long evolving build throughout, and some distortion. This is being released on the legendary Skint records too, which I'm quite excited about.

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Autumn Haze Egomodal EP Traum Schallplatten Melodic 44
tracks.title: Max Cooper - Autumn Haze (preview)
tracks.description: This is the A2 track from my new vinyl on Traum Schallpatten - It's a restrained melodic track which I tried to keep pure to it's concept, which was when I was sitting in my studio in Autumn, looking out the windows at the trees and nature which was clouded in mist. It had a really nice atmosphere which I tried to capture.

tracks.tag_list: Hugh Pascal Absence March Max Cooper Remix DSCNCTD disconnected records Pascall
tracks.title: Hugh Pascall - Absence March - Max Cooper Remix (Clip)
tracks.description:
This project was really enjoyable to work on because Hugh Pascall provided some amazing live instrumental parts with the trumpet and organ playing, which I caught a vibe from straight away and ran with to try make something a bit more in the techno/house space than the original, but still very much keeping the original idea.

I heartedly recommend checking out the originals on this release, they're awesome, full of character and soul, and are being released on vinyl only, with 300 hand stamped and numbered copies....some exclusive business!...a different way of doing things by DSCNCTD records than my usual.

tracks.tag_list: Pig and Dan Tears of a clown Max Cooper Remix Techno Therapy Records Traum Schallplatten Melodic
tracks.title: Pig and Dan - Tears of a clown - Max Cooper's Expanded Remix (clip)
tracks.description: I did this remix for Techno Therapy records, which will be released on all platforms 20th June. I loved the strings sample from the original track so it wasn't a hard mix to work on, I just built what I thought worked best around that one part, and this is the result. Hope you like it! Ps I think there's a vinyl for the release to, but whether or not this mix features on there I don't know.

tracks.title: Max Cooper - The End Of Reason - Ambient Rework
tracks.description: I took the drums out of the original track which was released on Traum some time ago, and I think it's actually a lot more true to the style of the piece this way. This ambient version was initially released as part of "Series" on itunes exclusive, but is now on full release on all platforms in the Empirisch EP because people kept asking where they could buy the wav!

tracks.tag_list: Ripperton A Skilift Upstairs The Sleeping City Max Cooper Remix Systematic
tracks.title: Ripperton - A Skilift Upstairs The Sleeping City - Max Cooper Remix

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Simplexity Egomodal EP Traum Schallplatten Simplicity Complexity Electronica Bass
tracks.title: Max Cooper - Simplexity (preview)
tracks.description: For this track I wanted to combine simplicity and complexity, so I went for a simple broken beat structure and bassline, and then used lots of Max for Live shenanigans to modulate the drums and hats and vocals in an interesting way, playing with psychoacoustics and detail as much as I could. It's a bit of a weird one, but I've been playing it out a lot and it seems to work!

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Echoes Reality Empirisch EP Traum Schallplatten
tracks.title: Echoes Reality (preview clip)

tracks.tag_list: Microtrauma Contrast Max Cooper Remix Traum Schallplatten Colourblind EP
tracks.title: Microtrauma - Contrast - Max Cooper Remix - Preview Clip
tracks.description: This one is my latest remix for Traum, of a track by Microtrauma coming out at the start of March. I loved the eerie vocals and groove on some hi-end drums from the original, so I took those and built a new chord arrangement over them, sticking to a simple understated feel throughout....it's supposed to be a quite relaxed track basically, I must be getting old!

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Qualia Empirisch EP Traum Schallplatten Echoes Reality Techno Deep Melodic
tracks.title: Qualia (preview clip)
tracks.description: I wanted to make something deep and soothing with this one, nothing too hectic or in your face, but with plenty of interesting production to keep it fresh despite the subtle structure. I was toying with various names along the lines of some sort of introspective, peaceful theme, so I went for qualia - not exactly a specifically peaceful term, but something relating to introspection, and with a lot of interesting associated theory behind it.

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Enveloped Expressions EP Traum Schallplatten
tracks.title: Max Cooper - Enveloped (Clip)
tracks.description: This is the A2 track on my new EP on Traum, out digitally and on 12" 1st November along with a Maetrik remix and 2 more originals. Ryan Davis has also done a great remix of this track, which is out 17th November along with remixes from Marc Marzenit and Echaskech. Ps check out the artwork from Ben Slater!

tracks.tag_list: Sasha Xpander Max Cooper Remix Expander Traum Deconstruction
tracks.title: Sasha - Xpander - Max Cooper Remix Clip
tracks.description: I was pretty excited to get the opportunity to remix this iconic track from 1999, and it proved a difficult remix given the strength and familiarity of the hook - I couldn't really change it without it sounding a bit like Xpander but not quite as good! So I decided to follow exactly what Sasha had asked me to do, which was "wonk the fuck out of it". The result was some wonked bits and teasing out of the hook, while sticking reasonably closely to the original on the drops. I hope you like it! ps This is a clip, the full length track has an additional intro and outro so it's mixable.

tracks.tag_list: peaches i feel cream max cooper remix
tracks.title: Peaches - I Feel Cream - Max Cooper Remix (Clip)

tracks.tag_list: Andrew K The Doppler Effect Max Cooper Remix Vice Versa Music Traum Schallplatten
tracks.title: Andrew K - The Doppler Effect - Max Cooper Remix
tracks.description: This one is simple but effective - 3 note riff, break, build, distorted smash, done. I've been playing it a lot recently, a good one for the clubs.

tracks.tag_list: Minilogue Seconds Max Cooper Remix Traum Schallplatten Melodic Space Techno
tracks.title: Minilogue - Seconds - Max Cooper Remix - Out Now on Traum
tracks.description: This remix of seconds by Minilogue is out on 12" and Digital along with amazing remixes from Dominic Eulberg and Freska of another Minilogue classic - Certain Things.

tracks.tag_list: Max Cooper Heresy Metaphysical EP Traum Schallplatten Vinyl Dubstep Electronica Exploding Eardrums Techno Melodic
tracks.title: Heresy (Clip)
tracks.description: This is the second track on my new 12" on Traum  - Metaphysical EP, out 4th April. It's a sort of broken/electronica influenced track, which you may have heard before on my Modus and Contortions live sets. It's pretty noisey I admit, but hopefully in a way that carries the energy of the track, rather than just exploding peoples eardrums!

tracks.tag_list: Bass
tracks.title: Au Revoir Simone - Take Me As I Am - Max Cooper Remix
tracks.description:
A remix I made for Au Revoir Simone, a slow dubby sort of affair, not really for the the dancefloor.

I didn't want to use the full vocals so I went for a high-passed ghostly sort of effect with them, it catches some nice bands in the top of her voice though!

tracks.tag_list: Maxime Miville Don't Ask Max Cooper Remix Wide Angle Recordings
tracks.title: Maxime Miville - Don't Ask - Max Cooper Remix
tracks.description: I recent remix I did for Wide Angle Recordings, out now.

tracks.tag_list: Extrawelt, Max Cooper, Remix, Traum, Mit Liese
tracks.title: Extrawelt - Mit Liese Auf Der Wiese - Max Cooper Remix (Traum)
tracks.description: A recent remix I have done for extrawelt, with my own vocals on the track! - Available on vinyl and digital along with some great mixes from Dominik Eulberg, Mig Dfoe, Ricardo Tobar and Applescal

title: Max Cooper Intro Reel
